roleset.name: give someone credit for smth, recognition

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: But Wang Ta - chih credits his father for instilling in him a love of literature , and encouraging him to become proficient in traditional Chinese disciplines such as painting , chess , woodwind music and martial arts .
example.arg: for instilling in him a love of literature , and encouraging him to become proficient in traditional Chinese disciplines such as painting , chess , woodwind music and martial arts

example.name: passive
example.text: The 41-year-old Mr. Azoff , a former rock 'n' roll manager , is credited [*]with turning around MCA 's once-moribund music division in his six years at the company .
example.arg: The 41-year-old Mr. Azoff , a former rock 'n' roll manager ,
[*]with turning around MCA 's once-moribund music division in his six years at the company

example.name: Arg2 as a with-PP
example.text: Ohbayashi cited industry publications crediting Howell , currently capitalized at $ 2.2 million [*U*] , with receiving orders valued at $ 225 million [*U*]in 1988 .
example.arg: with receiving orders valued at $ 225 million [*U*]in 1988

example.name: Arg 2 in PP
example.text: The Bangladesh government also deserves credit for making significant progress toward eliminating child labor in the garment industry.
example.arg: for making significant progress toward eliminating child labor in the garment industry.

roleset.note: CREDIT-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls fulfilling-13.4.1-1. (from credit.01-v)
CREDIT-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'credit-v'. Vn class fulfilling-13.4.1-1. No Fn class. Framed by Katie. (from credit.01-n)

example.name: with Arg1 and Arg2
example.text: As interest rates paid depositors were lowered , thrift withdrawals exceeded deposits by $ 5.1 billion [*U*] , not including interest credited * to accounts .
